title: Megan McKenna leads the glamour with Zara McDermott and Samira Mighty at The X Factor: Celebrity
text:
Advertisement

They're just some of the stars named for the upcoming ITV series.

And Megan McKenna led the glamour with Love Island stars Zara McDermott and Samira Mighty at The X Factor: Celebrity photocall on Wednesday afternoon.

Megan, 27, opted to go braless in a black and white patterned suit with a plunging figure-hugging blazer and matching flared trousers.

Work it: Megan McKenna led the glamour with Love Island stars Zara McDermott and Samira Mighty at The X Factor: Celebrity photocall on Wednesday afternoon (L-R)

The former TOWIE star teamed the items of clothing with a pair of black barely-there heeled sandals, a burgundy clutch bag and collection of jewellery.

Megan, who launched a successful music career in 2017 with her hit High Heeled Shoes, styled her blonde locks into a glossy voluminous blow-dried hairdo, she added a slick of glamorous make-up.

Meanwhile, Zara and Samira, who have joined together with Wes Nelson and Eyal Booker to form band The Islanders, opted to go for similar ball gowns.

Daring: Megan, 27, opted to go braless in a black and white patterned suit with a plunging figure-hugging blazer and matching flared trousers

Glamorous: Megan, who launched a successful music career in 2017 with her hit High Heeled Shoes, styled her blonde locks into a glossy voluminous blow-dried hairdo, she added a slick of glamorous make-up

Mwah: The reality star appeared in good spirits at the photocall as she playfully blew kisses on the red carpet

Candid: She previously said about whether she's nervous of X Factor judge and boss Simon Cowell: 'Wow, it’s a big deal because I just think Simon could say one thing and it can make people change their mind about you, you know?'

Zara, 23, looked effortlessly elegant in a floor-length plunging blue sparkly patterned gown with a mesh insert on the neckline.

The new Made In Chelsea star, who is dating E4 star Sam Thompson, added height to her frame with a pair of silver heels and accessorised with a matching clutch bag.

Zara styled her blonde locks into a blow-dried hairdo and added a slick of glamorous make-up for the star-studded photocall.

Elegant: Zara, 23, looked effortlessly elegant in a floor-length plunging blue sparkly patterned gown with a mesh insert on the neckline

Strike a pose: The new Made In Chelsea star, who is dating E4 star Sam Thompson, added height to her frame with a pair of silver heels and accessorised with a matching clutch bag

Peachy: Meanwhile Samira, 22, opted for a daring nude strapless bodysuit, which showcased her peachy posterior, with a sheer sequinned chiffon skirt over the top with a daring thigh-high split

Red carpet ready: The Love Island star accessorised her look with a pair of barely-there perspex heels and a stylish purple clutch bag

The Islanders: Zara and Samira have joined together with Wes Nelson and Eyal Booker to form band The Islanders, they all appeared on the 2018 series of Love Island

Dapper: Eyal, 24, left, and Wes, 21, right, both looked dapper in all-black ensembles for the star-studded photocall

Stylish: Eyal wore a black suit with a matching coloured unbuttoned shirt, white trainers and a silver chain necklace

Meanwhile Samira, 22, opted for a daring nude strapless bodysuit, which showcased her peachy posterior, with a sheer sequinned chiffon skirt over the top with a daring thigh-high split.

The Love Island star accessorised her look with a pair of barely-there perspex heels and a stylish purple clutch bag.

Samira styled her brunette locks into a sleek straightened hairdo and added a slick of glamorous make-up for the event.

Sensational: The X Factor judge Nicole Scherzinger looked incredible for the photocall as she displayed her toned curves in a grey patterned asymmetrical crop top and matching figure-hugging ruffled midi skirt

Accessories: The Pussycat Dolls star, 41, accessorised her look with a pair of black velvet heels, cat eyed sunglasses and glamorous gold hooped earrings

Bold look: Nicole opted for a bold hair look as she styled her brunette locks into a gelled back look and added a slick of glamorous make-up

Happy: The Wet hitmaker appeared in good spirits as she posed up a storm on the red carpet and sweetly blew kisses to fans

Playful: At one stage, Nicole put on a playful display as she threw her arms in the air and made an animated facial expression

The X Factor judge Nicole Scherzinger looked incredible for the photocall as she displayed her toned curves in a grey patterned asymmetrical crop top and matching figure-hugging ruffled midi skirt.

The Pussycat Dolls star, 41, accessorised her look with a pair of black velvet heels, cat eyed sunglasses and glamorous gold hooped earrings.

Nicole opted for a bold hair look as she styled her brunette locks into a gelled back look and added a slick of glamorous make-up.

The Wet hitmaker appeared in good spirits as she posed up a storm on the red carpet and sweetly blew kisses to fans.

Nicole joined fellow judge Louis Walsh and presenter Dermot O'Leary, but one member of the judging panel who appeared to be missing was show creator Simon Cowell.

Stunning: Love Actually star Olivia Olson, 27, looked incredible in a green leopard print slip dress with a daring thigh-split

Glamorous: Hayley Hasselhoff, 27, looked glamorous in a black velvet ensemble with a dramatic green furry collar

Radiant: Coronation Street star Victoria Ekanoye, 36, looked radiant in a stunning plunging yellow silk dress

Sweet: Ricki Lake, 51, was joined by her beloved service dog Mama on the red carpet as she sweetly posed for a photo

Work it: Ricki wore a white frilled out mini skirt with an oversized grey T-shirt, brown knee-high boots and gold necklaces

As well as Megan and The Islanders, the 12 other contestants were in attendance: Ricki Lake, 51, Try Star - made up of rugby players Thom Evans, 34, Levi Davis, 21, Ben Foden, 34, The Chase star Jenny Ryan, 37, Cole & Edwards - made up of Strictly star - Brendan Cole, 43 and actor Jeremy Edwards, 48, Glee star Kevin McHale, 31.

Other contestants at the photocall included: EastEnders star Jonny Labey, 26, Hayley Hasselhoff, 27, Love Actually star Olivia Olson, 27, journalist Martin Bashir, 56, V5 - made up of influencers Sofia, Alondra, Laura, Wendii and Natalie, presenters and twins Max and Harvey, both 16, and Coronation Street star Victoria Ekanoye, 36.

Only recently, in an interview ahead of the launch, Simon, 60, revealed the reason why he decided to revamp the normal show into a celebrity version.

'It just felt so obvious to do a celebrity version', he explained. 'The only condition was I couldn’t know who was going to be on it. I said to the team, "You’ve got to find some acts who you believe can sell records off the back of this, because if you don’t do that it won’t work."

Sparkly: The Chase star Jenny Ryan, 37, looked amazing in a floor-length striped sparkly metallic wrap dress with a plunging neckline and matching waist belt

V5: Group V5 made up of influencers Sofia, Alondra, Laura and Wendii attended the photocall, Natalie appeared to be missing

Music: Alondra said of getting into music: 'I’ve been dancing for so long that I don’t even remember getting into music, but I started singing at 15 when I wanted to audition for a singing show!'

Handsome: Try Star - made up of rugby players Thom Evans, 34, Levi Davis, 21, Ben Foden, 34, all posed together on the red carpet

'So that was the deal and we stuck to it. I swear to God I didn’t have a clue who any of the acts were. I did walk away thinking, “If we’re smart, we have artists here who could actually sell records off the back of this”. So I thought that was fun and very exciting for the show.'

The music boss also shared how he felt about holding the auditions in his own back garden.

He said: 'When we filmed it that night it didn’t feel like work. I loved every second of it. I said to the producers, “If this really doesn’t work, we will have to re-audition for the show. That’s the deal.”

'So the fact that I felt we didn’t need to was just great. I found it interesting and fun, and doing this version of the show has also given me the chance to do All Stars. I’ve wanted to make the best of the best version of The X Factor for a long, long time. It’s been brilliant. I’ve loved every minute.'

Meanwhile, returning judge Louis, 67, revealed why he's so excited about the show, adding that the contestants are not what people will expect.

Contestants: Journalist Martin Bashir, left, Glee star Kevin McHale, centre, and EastEnders star Jonny Labey, far right, at the photocall

Fun times: Cole & Edwards - made up of Strictly star Brendan Cole, 43 and actor Jeremy Edwards, 48, playfully posed on the red carpet

Family: Presenters and twins Max and Harvey, both 16, posed together on the red carpet

He said: 'What we’re doing this year I think is a brilliant idea. I think everyone’s going to love watching these celebrities because it’s not what people expect. Some of them are really good.

'The show feels more exciting, there’s no bootcamp, no six chair challenge, it feels slick this year. It’s been the best show on TV for a long time and has just had a little rebranding, I suppose, a new X Factor.'

While Nicole explained why the celebrity version differs from the civilian edition.

She explained: 'Obviously it’s a lot shorter, which is the difference between The X Factor: Celebrity and the ones in the past. This one doesn’t have boot camp and all that jazz, and I loved that we just cut straight to the chase. I was really excited to see who the celebrities were going to be.'

X Factor: Nicole joined fellow judge Louis Walsh but one member of the judging panel who appeared to be missing was show creator Simon Cowell

Presenter: Dermot O'Leary looked dapper for the photocall in dark trousers with a black top and brown suede dress shoes

And the Don't Hold Your Breath hitmaker ensured that she'll be as competitive as ever this year.

'Oh always!' she insisted. 'You can’t take that out of me! I’m just going to be very supportive. This year I think the way Simon has done it is that we help them and support them. In the past when I did it, I was quite hands-on and did a lot. But I’m ready to see what they are going to bring to this show.'

This series, like the civilian version, will see the acts split into three groups; the overs, the unders and the groups.

The X Factor: Celebrity starts Saturday 12th October 8:35pm on ITV.
